segments.text: are your ready to go to the supermarket ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've got my money and my keys , so I'm ready .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: you do know that it's absolutely freezing out , don't you ? I'd put a coat on if I were you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it wasn't cold out this morning .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , it's started raining since then . Look out the window ! It's pouring rain out there !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: well , I guess we'd better grab our umbrellas then , as well .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: have a look outside for me . Does that look like hail to you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it does , actually . Maybe we should wait for it to clear up before we go shopping .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's a good idea . But maybe we should move the car so that the hail doesn't dent it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: ok . I'll go move the car if you turn the heat on . It's a bit chilly in here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: how long do you think this hailstorm is supposed to last ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . The weatherman didn't say anything about this in his weather report last night .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: maybe we should turn on the news in case it's supposed to get worse .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't think we have anything to worry about . Do you want to put on a cup of tea as well ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: good idea . That will help us to warm up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: if I'm not back in ten minutes , come and find me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: alright . I'll have a cup of tea waiting for you .
segments.speaker: S2
